title: Please help ID these fonts!
content:
Hi -- Please could you help me identify fonts 1 to 4 in the attached, or recommend similar-looking fonts? -- Many thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Fonts_3746.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Font ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-07-31%20at%2013.45.51.png) | 248.18 KB |
author: AndreanaP

comments.content:
#1+4: [Peignot](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/www.identifont.com/show?GNN) by Cassandre.

#2: Try Sackers Gothic, Engravers Gothic, ITC Blair …

# 3: Could be [Flemish Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/www.identifont.com/show?24N) or Flemish Script II.

1/4: [Peignot](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/peignot)  
2: some sort [Engravers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/engravers+gothic/)/ [Blair](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/blair/)/ [Sackers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/sackers+gothic/) (rounded?). More: [Burin Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/burin-sans), [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/gotham/overview) (or [Gotham Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/gotham-rounded/overview)), [Bryant](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/bryant)  
ELYSEES 98-84: looks like [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803035116/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/futura) to me

Thanks for the replies!

Renko, I've tried the Peignot by Cassandre but it seems to be more compact than the original font. Is there another version of this font? Or something I can do to change the distance between each letter?

Yep!

I remember when I was using InDesign back when I was in college I could change the letter spacing in there. Is this how you'd go about changing it yourself?
